sub_title: Project Manager Middle East & North Africa at VNG International
summary:
Currently Project Manager for VNG International in North Africa and Middle East, wherein responsible for projects in Tunisia, Egypt, and Oman portfolios’ management and acquisition, focusing on strengthening local governance, institutional capacity building, and stabilization, both locally and nationally.

Eager and continuous learner, with a problem-solving and learning-by-doing attitude. Driven to learn and gain more experience in and around my fields of interest, specifically environmental, natural resource, and climate challenges, as well as their relations to governance.

education.degree_name: BA International Relations and International Organization

organizations.name: Students Association Clio
organizations.position: Member of the Board of Advisors

profile_positions.location: The Hague, South Holland Province, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Project Manager for North Africa, wherein responsible for project management and acquisition in Tunisia, Egypt, and Oman on supporting decentralization processes and reforms, inclusive local governance, and sustainable development. Also working on acquisition and business development in North Africa and Middle East more broadly.

Project management, business development, and acquisition for development projects of the European Union, Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and the World Bank.

On-going projects:
Project d’Appui à la Réforme de Décentralisation et Déconcentration en Tunisie (2019-2022, European Union)

Improved Service Delivery at the Local Level, Libya (2019-2022, European Union)

Improving Sustainability of the WASH Sector in Upper Egypt (2021-2024, Embassy of the Netherlands)

Upper Egypt Local Development Program, Implementation Support Consultancy (2018-2023, Ministry of Local Development of Egypt)
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Middle East & North Africa
Junior Business Development Officer (Maternity leave cover)

profile_positions.description:
WRI Europe represents the World Resources Institute in Europe. In The Hague, it works to increase WRI’s global impact by fostering innovative partnerships, sharing WRI research findings, and ensuring that WRI learns from European insights and experience in development and environmental protection. WRI Europe actively engages with bilateral donors, foundations and other partners to mobilize funding to support our work. As a whole it engages with European partners to advance shared goals of sustainable development. 

- Outreach support on WRI core sustainability topics and WRI Europe core topics of circular economy (including the Platform for Accelerating Circular Economy), and water, peace, and security, to maintain as well as bring in new funding. 
- Preparation and support for external presentations and meetings (such as circular economy and corporate sustainable action and investing) and coordination with offices to uphold donor partnerships and engagement, as well as defining potential new bilateral funders. 
- Briefings on various European matters (political environment, EU policies, grant availabilities, tender notices) related to all WRI work in development and sustainability and core topics of Forests, Water, Oceans, Cities, Energy, Climate, and Food.
- Drafting and supporting partner and stakeholder engagement strategies between WRI and donor countries, defining priorities for bilateral relations based on the interests of WRI and the interests of European partner countries and their governments/development agencies.
- Maintaining Salesforce up-to-date with interactions of WRI with funders and partners, as well as on opportunities. 
- Personal long-term project on how EU grants and funding could be better leveraged within WRI and how to solve issues therein (incl. deepening knowledge on Commission and Horizon2020 funding for development and environment, defining the benefits of engaging in calls for proposals as well as the challenges and approaches to them).
profile_positions.title: Outreach & Operations Intern WRI Europe

profile_positions.description:
Chairing a Board with the aim of facilitating academic researches for companies, organizations, and/or governments, conducted by Master students of International Relations.
Partners in need of research for their on-going operations are connected to teams of suitable senior-students to gain practical experience next to their studies. The Board oversees the research process to ensure high quality and fulfillment of the partner’s needs. The final researches are published and are used by the partners in their operations.

In 2016-17 our researches were conducted for: 
- Energy Research Center of the Netherlands (ECN) on analyzing existing initiatives on COP21 action plans in order for ECN and the German government to identify areas which are not yet covered and need support.
- Terre des Hommes Netherlands to research gender mainstreaming and how the organization can implement it into their strategy.

http://www.irsp.nl/2016-2017.html
profile_positions.title: Chairwoman of the International Research by Students Programme

profile_positions.description:
Fundraising and project management assistance:
- Country briefings and background research on open tenders and potential for projects, as well as on other actors and their on-going projects (largely for Balkan/Eastern European/Central Asian countries and opportunities for developing democracy and transparency in their governance structures in line with CESS work).
- Identifying and engaging local partner organizations and cooperating on tender proposals and project preparation/design. Identifying needs in countries via communication with target groups and locals on the ground to define desirable actions.
- Drafting and supporting project proposals for tenders and other potential funders and coordinating deadlines for proposals submissions.
- Assisting with project management and set-up of the Europe-Central Asia Monitoring initiative (EUCAM) on EU-Central Asia relations and policies, including a larger brief on the inclusion of Central Asia in EU terrorism policy.
- General communications and PR management for both CESS and EUCAM.
profile_positions.title: Program and Fundraising Intern
